required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Psychometric Properties of the Turkish Version of Young Children's Participation and Environment Measure
clinical_study.official_title: Psychometric Properties of the Turkish Version of Young Children's Participation and Environment Measure (YC-PEM) in Young Children With Typical Development and Neurodevelopmental Disorders

brief_summary.textblock: The Young Children's Participation and Environment Measure (YC-PEM) is a parent/caregiver reported outcome measure that evaluates the participation status and environmental factors of children under five years old. The aim of this study is to translate the Young Children's Participation and Environment Measure (YC-PEM) into the Turkish language and to investigate the psychometric properties of the Turkish version of YC-PEM in children with typical development and neurodevelopmental disabilities under five years old.

detailed_description.textblock: Cross-cultural adaptation Rest-retest reliability Discriminant validity Concurrent validity

primary_outcome.measure: Young children's participation and environment measure (YC- PEM)
primary_outcome.description: Young children's participation and environment measure (YC- PEM) is developed for assessing the activity and participation levels and effects of environmental factors on functional abilities in children with neurodevelopmental disabilities or typically development under five years.

secondary_outcome.description: Pediatric Evaluation of Disability Inventory (PEDI) for assessing the activity and participation levels and effects of environmental factors on functional abilities in children with neurodevelopmental disabilities or typically development under seven years.

study_pop.textblock: Children with typical development and children with neurodevelopmental disabilities (Cerebral palsy, obstetric brachial plexus palsy, autism spectrum disorders or developmental coordination disorders etc.)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- children under five years
- children with neurodevelopmental disabilities
Exclusion Criteria:
- parents who refused to participate in the study
